--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Jim O'Flaherty, Jr." 
<jim_oflaherty_jr@y...> wrote:
> As for my disagreement - Evolution may remain an unintended 
> process  I feel this just describes
> its origins.  However, I do not think it can be said accurately it 
> remains undirected.

Well as long as there has been agriculture and domestication of 
plants and animals there has been directed evolution.  The particular 
selection pressure applied by humans to isolated populations has a 
name: Artificial Selection.  It's how we got poodles and flower shops.

But certainly you don't mean to say that natural selection (and other 
evolutionary pressures) still aren't acting upon millions of species 
worldwide every day?

Derek
